courses.name: Class Piano
courses.description: Functional piano training for beginners. Development of techniques for school and community playing. Basic piano techniques; chord, arpeggio and scale techniques; melody and song playing; simple accompaniments, improvisation for accompaniments and rhythms; sight reading and transposition and playing by ear.

courses.name: Beginning Class Piano II
courses.description: Functional piano training for beginners. Development of techniques useful for school and community playing. Basic piano techniques; chord, arpeggio, and scale techniques; melody and song playing; simple accompaniments, improvisation for accompaniments and rhythms; sight reading and transposition, and playing by ear. MUSC103 is a continuation of MUSC102; elementary repertoire is begun.

courses.name: Beginning Classical Guitar
courses.description: Introduction to classical guitar notation, technique, literature and performance. No previous musical experience required.

courses.name: Vocal Diction: English
courses.description: An introduction to the fundamentals of phonetics and sound production as applied to singing English vocal literature through detailed work with IPA, the International Phonetic Alphabet.

courses.name: Ensemble; Chamber Strings
courses.description: Contact instructor to make arrangements. For Music majors only.

courses.name: Ensemble; Chamber Woodwinds
courses.description: Contact instructor to make arrangements. For Music majors only.

courses.name: Ensemble; Chamber Brasses
courses.description: For Music majors only.

courses.name: Ensemble; Advanced Japanese Koto
courses.description: Prerequisite: Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: What Does Music Mean?
courses.description: An examination of how music creates meaning in different eras, through studying musical sound, biography, and social history.

courses.name: Music Fundamentals I
courses.description: Introductory theory course. Notation, scales, intervals, triads, rhythm, form and basic aural skills.

courses.name: Theory of Music II
courses.description: A continuation of MUSC150, including study of more advanced harmonic techniques of the eighteenth century, such as modulation and chromatic harmonies. Emphasis on sight singing, ear training, analysis and compositional skills.

courses.name: Intermediate Class Piano II
courses.description: Advanced keyboard techniques. Continuation of skills introduced in MUSC202. Transposition, modulation and sight reading; methods of teaching functional piano. Development of style in playing accompaniments and in playing for community singing. More advanced repertory.

courses.name: Popular Music in Black America
courses.description: Traces black popular music in the U.S. with a special focus on spirituals, ragtime, the blues, early jazz, R&B, Motown, funk, soul, and rap. Examines how these styles have been borrowed by the American music industry.

courses.name: History of Popular Music, 1950-Present
courses.description: A historical survey of rock music (blues, rock, soul, metal, rap, etc.) from circa 1950 to the present, with emphasis on popular music as music and popular music as social history.

courses.name: The Impact of Music on Life
courses.description: Music as a part of culture. Materials drawn from traditions throughout the globe to illustrate issues of historical and contemporary significance, including the impact of race, class and gender on the study of music.

courses.name: World Popular Musics and Identity
courses.description: Focus on popular musics in different cultures with an emphasis on cross-cultural comparisons and analysis of how musics and identity intersect.

courses.name: Selected Musical Cultures of the World
courses.description: A critical and comparative exploration of musical practices from around the world in their social, political and economic contexts.

courses.name: Vocal Diction: French
courses.description: Augmentation of private voice study. Phonetics and diction for singers of French vocal literature.

courses.name: Ensemble; Symphony Orchestra
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Wind Orchestra
courses.description: Open by audition. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Wind Ensemble
courses.description: Open by audition. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Marching Band: Drumline and Auxiliary
Ensemble; Jazz Ensemble
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; University Orchestra
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; University Band
courses.description: Open by audition.  Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Jazz Combo
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Elements of Music Composition for Non-Majors
courses.description: Emphasizes learning concepts and techniques of music composition through the study of music theory and structure used in both classical and popular music forms. Students will compose music using computer assisted and composition tools. These tools include cloud based digital audio workstations and music notation programs. Compositions will be written in these musical styles but not limited to classical, jazz, and popular. Students will also explore methods of sharing their compositions on various digital platforms.

courses.name: Advanced Theory of Music II
courses.description: A continuation of MUSC250, concentrating on late nineteenth-century chromatic harmony and an introduction to twentieth-century melody and harmony. Emphasis on sight singing, ear training, analysis and compositional skills.

courses.name: Introduction to Chamber Music for Pianists
Ensemble; University of Maryland Chorale
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Chamber Singers
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Music in Western Culture Before 1900
courses.description: Course will be looking at roughly 800 years of Western art music in Europe and America (ca.1100-1900) through the lens of selected "moments"--intersections of historical space and time, observing music as an art form practiced in a public eye, both as a social event and a cultural practice.

courses.name: Music Pedagogy
courses.description: Conference course. A study of major pedagogical treatises in music, and an evaluation of pedagogical techniques, materials, and procedures.

courses.name: Jazz: Then and Now
courses.description: Major styles and influential artists of the past 75 years of jazz.

courses.name: Area Studies in Ethnomusicology; Music of Latino/a Communities in the US
Wind and Percussion Literature
courses.description: Recital program notes and written projects in wind or percussion literature.

courses.name: Survey of the Opera
courses.description: A study of the music, librettos and composers of the standard operas.

courses.name: String Literature
courses.description: Recital program notes and written projects in string literature.

courses.name: Selected Topics in Music; Accompanying Practicum
Selected Topics in Music; Style Analysis
Selected Topics in Music; How to Win an Orchestral Audition
Selected Topics in Music; Instrumental Pedagogy
Musical Form
courses.description: A study of the principles of organization in music with emphasis on eighteenth and nineteenth century European music. Reading and analysis of scores exemplifying the musical forms.

courses.name: Jazz Improvisation II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC453 including scoring and transcription.

courses.name: Jazz Arranging
courses.description: A comprehensive approach to jazz arranging. Topics to include chord scale theory, voicing techniques, part and score layout, and formal construction of an arrangement.

courses.name: Theory and Analysis of Atonal and Twelve-tone Music
courses.description: An advanced technical introduction to theory and analysis of atonal and twelve-tone music, with an emphasis on music by Schoenberg, Webern, Bartok, and Stravinsky.

courses.name: Technology and a Career in Music
courses.description: A hands-on introduction to technology as it applies to music creation and recording. Digital audio workstations, music notation software, and cloud-based music technology are used to create and manipulate musical examples with an eye toward their practical applications for professional musicians.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; Viola
courses.description: Cross-listed with MUSC669D. Credit only granted for MUSC469D or MUSC669D.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; Bass
Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; HARP
Harmonic and Contrapuntal Practices of the Twentieth Century
courses.description: A theoretical and analytical study of twentieth century materials.

courses.name: Music Composition for Music Majors
courses.description: A course for music majors who wish to develop skills and creative abilities in music composition. Student writing projects will be discussed in class and models of compositional techniques will be studied in literature from diverse styles and style periods.

courses.name: Music in the Renaissance
courses.description: Survey of western music from 1450 to 1600.

courses.name: Conducting
courses.description: Vocal and instrumental baton techniques.

courses.name: Conducting II
courses.description: Baton techniques applied to score reading, rehearsal techniques, tone production, style and interpretation.

courses.name: Keyboard Music II
courses.description: The history and literature of harpsichord and solo piano music from the Romantic period to the present. Emphasis is placed on those segments of repertory which are encountered in performance and teaching situations at the present time.

courses.name: Advanced Italian Lyric Diction
courses.description: Concepts, strategies and techniques for singing operatic and song literature in Italian: syllabification, vowels, stressed and unstressed syllables, dipthongs, glides and elisions, single and double consonants with emphasis on current performance practices.

courses.name: Advanced German Lyric Diction
courses.description: Concepts, strategies and techniques for singing operatic and song literature in German: single and double consonants, the use of the glottal, the German closed (e) and (o) vowels, the "schwa" and consonant clusters. Mastery of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA) as it applies to "Hochdeutsch" will be expected.

courses.name: Opera Repertory II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC 605. Advanced vocal coaching of selections from the Italian, French, German and English opera repertory: musical accuracy, language facility; diction clarity; and dramatic interpretation.

courses.name: Chamber Music Repertory; Chamber Music Repertoire
Piano Chamber Music Practicum and Analysis
Opera Techniques II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC 611. Techniques for opera performance: Scene Study II; Movement II; and Mask.

courses.name: Opera Techniques IV
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC 613. Techniques for opera performance: Scene Study IV and Movement IV.

courses.name: Ensemble; Symphony Orchestra
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Jazz Ensemble
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Advanced Japanese Koto
courses.description: Prerequisite: Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Repertoire Orchestra
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; University Band
courses.description: Open by audition.  Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Wind Orchestra
courses.description: Open by audition.  Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Jazz Combo
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Field Methods in Ethnomusicology
courses.description: Introduction to ethnographic theory and fieldwork methods (participant observation, interviewing, etc.) in ethnomusicology. Students develop and carry out their own fieldwork projects as part of the course.

courses.name: Seminar in Vocal Pedagogy
courses.description: A study of the physiological, psychological and acoustical aspects of the teaching of singing combined with independent study and research in areas of individual interest.

courses.name: Ensemble; University of Maryland Chorale
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Ensemble; Chamber Singers
courses.description: Audition required before permission of department will be granted. Contact instructor to make arrangements.

courses.name: Jazz Improvisation II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC653, study of jazz improvisation techniques through analysis, transcription and composition.

courses.name: Jazz Arranging
courses.description: Comprehensive approach to jazz arranging, including chord scale theory, voicing techniques, part and score layout, and formal construction of an arrangement.

courses.name: Seminar in Repertoire and Pedagogy; Choral Repertoire and Pedagogy
Seminar in Repertoire and Pedagogy; Orchestral Repertoire and Pedagogy
Seminar in Repertoire and Pedagogy; Wind Repertoire and Pedagogy
Theory and Analysis of Atonal and Twelve-Tone Music
courses.description: An introduction to the advanced theoretical literature in atonal and twelve-tone music with an emphasis on analytical applications to music by prominent 20th-century composers.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; Viola
courses.description: Cross-listed with MUSC469D. Credit only granted for MUSC469D or MUSC669D.

courses.name: Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; BASS
Orchestral Excerpts for String Players; HARP
Masterworks of the 20th Century: 1900-1950
courses.description: A comprehensive survey of Western Art-Music of the first half of the 20th Century with a more intensive study and analysis of composers who have had a profound influence in the development of compositional practice in the modern era.

courses.name: Style Analysis
courses.description: An analytical study of musical style from the Middle Ages to present through analysis of selected compositions. The principle genres and composers of Medieval, Renaissance, Baroque, Classical, Romantic and 20th century music will be covered.

courses.name: Seminar in Ethnomusicology; Music and Leftist Political Movements in the Americas
Selected Topics in Music; Music, Art, and Architecture Pre-1700
Selected Topics in Music; Vocal Coaching
Selected Topics in Music; Instrumental Pedagogy
Selected Topics in Music; Minimalist Music
Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in performance and literature.

courses.name: Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in performance and literature.

courses.name: Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in performance and literature.

courses.name: Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in performance and literature.

courses.name: Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in performance and literature.

courses.name: Advanced Seminar in Music Pedagogy III
courses.description: A detailed study of historical and contemporary methods of pedagogy, and analysis of pedagogical problems. Sectioning by instrument.

courses.name: Doctoral Opera Techniques II
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC811. Techniques for opera preformance: Scene Study II; Acting II; Movement II: Stage Combat I; and Mask; and methodology seminar.

courses.name: Doctoral Opera Techniques IV
courses.description: Continuation of MUSC813. Techniques for opera performance: Scene Study IV; Dance II; Movement IV; and methodology seminar.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Literature
courses.description: An analytical survey of the literature of music: keyboard music; vocal music; string music; wind instrument music; required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in literature-performance.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Literature
courses.description: An analytical survey of the literature of music: keyboard music; vocal music; string music; wind instrument music. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in literature-performance.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Literature
courses.description: An analytical survey of the literature of music: keyboard music; vocal music; string music; wind instrument music. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in literature-performance.

courses.description: An analytical survey of the literature of music: keyboard music; vocal music; string music; wind instrument music. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in literature-performance.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Literature
courses.description: An analytical survey of the literature of music: keyboard music; vocal music; string music; wind instrument music. Required of all candidates for the D.M.A. Degree in literature-performance.

courses.name: Doctoral Seminar in Music Literature
